questions.question: What does Full Stack development involve?

options.label: Developing only the front end of the web application
Developing only the back end of the web application
Developing both the front end and back end of the web application
Managing databases but not developing any part of the web application

questions.question: What is the role of a Full Stack Web Developer?

options.label: They only program databases.
They only program servers.
They only program browsers.
They are familiar with programming both client and server software.
Two programmers share a single workstation and swap roles every few minutes.
One programmer writes the code, while the other only watches.
Two programmers work separately and combine their code at the end.
One programmer writes the code, while the other tests it.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Observer pattern?

options.label: To define a hierarchy of objects.
To deal with event handling.
To define a one-to-many dependency between objects.
To define a many-to-many dependency between objects.

questions.question: What does the acronym ACID stand for in Database systems?

options.label: Atomicity, Concurrency, Isolation, Durability
Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, Durability
Atomicity, Concurrency, Immutability, Durability
Atomicity, Consistency, Immutability, Deletion
A software framework that allows creation of server environments only.
A software framework that allows creation of both web applications and server environments.
A software framework that allows storage and management of data.
A software framework that involves web scripting only.

questions.question: What is the difference between Server-side Scripting and Client-side Scripting?

options.label: Server-side scripting is executed on the client's machine while Client-side scripting is executed on the server.
Server-side scripting is executed on the server while Client-side scripting is executed on the client's machine.
Both are typically executed on the client's machine.
Both are typically executed on the server.
It is a software design pattern.
It is an application programming interface that uses HTTP requests to obtain and manage data.
It is a type of database system.
It is a web development framework.

questions.question: What are the differences between normalization and denormalization?

options.label: Normalization is used to add redundancy to execute queries and increase speed, while denormalization is used to reduce redundancy and improve consistency.
Normalization is used to increase performance, while denormalization is used to increase reliability.
Normalization is used to reduce data redundancy and inconsistency, while denormalization is used to add redundancy to execute queries faster.
Both are used for the same purpose - to improve database performance.
Cross-Origin Resource Sending
Cross-Object Request Service
Cross-Origin Reference Share
Cross-Origin Resource Sharing
It is a design pattern where a container handles the injection of service components into a client object.
It is a process where a container handles creation of objects.
It is a programming method where an object handles instantiation of other objects.
It is a design pattern where a container handles the retrieval of service components from a client object.

questions.question: What are the main types of design patterns?

options.label: Creational, Structural and Behavioral
Functional, Object-Oriented and Structural
Behavioral, Sequential and Parallel
Functional, Sequential and Parallel

questions.question: What is the difference between Full Stack engineer and Full Stack developer?

options.label: Full-Stack engineer has project management experience and can configure and manage computer networks and systems whereas a Full-Stack developer only programs client and server software
There is no difference both can program client and server software
Full-Stack developer has project management experience and can configure and manage computer networks and systems whereas a Full-Stack engineer only programs client and server software
Full-Stack engineer manages databases and a Full-Stack developer programs databases
